data.title: Font size zooming with touchpads

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Using a touchpad to zoom in or out is very hard as with the slightest movement the font changes by a lot. There is also no way to reset back to the original font size that I can find (and good luck doing it manually). If smooth scrolling can't be implemented at least the amount of zooming should be significantly decreased. I am using a macbook.
My suggestions are:
1) workbench.action.zoomReset should be binded by default to Cmd/Ctrl+0 (standard shortcut in all Apps)
2) workbench.action.zoomReset should probably also be used to reset the zoom level of the font
3) Smooth zooming of font size
I could do the work and submit a patch for the first two but I am not sure how to proceed with the third.

data.title: HTML folding not working as expected with unformatted code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open test.html from the provided .zip file.
2. Try folding the first div (class="bars")
3. It seems that folding does not work when the code is not formatted correctly and it will stop at the first problematic element as demonstrated on the following screenshot.
   ![problematic-fold](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2611068/19269108/2a041060-8fc1-11e6-8027-ee2b9e897bef.PNG)

Maybe that is expected but I think that it makes it difficult to work with random html files which might be an everyday life for some people. I would expect that the whole div is collapsed no matter what the formatting of the child elements is. Not sure if other people expect the current behavior. Ideally there might be an option that dictates different folding modes for HTML.

I hope that this is not a duplicate but I couldn't find this exact issue in the list. Thank you. 

[folding-issue.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/521699/folding-issue.zip)

data.title: Quick find / Ctrl+F3 highlight regression (in Javascript in HTML files)
data.body:
**EDIT: JS inside HTML file**

If you place the cursor on a string `"hello"` and press `ctrl+f3` the quick find will mark `"hello"` including quotes. This is different from previous versions. Worse is if you do the same for a function definition in an object `_myFuncName: function() {}` the quick find will be `_myFuncName:` which includes the `:`.

Last example:
`this.set('something.bla.' + i + '.prop', 1);` place the cursor on 'something' and pressing `ctrl+f3` will highlight `this.set('something.bla.'`.
- VSCode Version:
  1.6.0
- OS Version:
  Windows 10

data.title: v8debug is not defined
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 10
- NodeJS: 4.6.0, 6.7.0, does not matter

After recent upgrade of VSCode (not sure which), language client does not utilize debug parameters sent to it because variable v8debug is not defined when debugging through vscode.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new extension according to official documentation https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/extensions/example-language-server
2. Launch the extension in debug mode and set a breakpoint in language client, main.js
See the following code for reference:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/blob/master/client/src/main.ts#L1027
The variable v8debug is not defined, therefore the next line json = runDebug.debug; is never executed.

data.title: Auto-formatting TSX removes signifigant whitespace
data.body:
When VSCode formats a TSX document it can remove significant white-space, altering the output of the program. ## VSCode Version: - Version: 1.6.0 - Commit: e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55 - Date: 2016-10-10T18:37:40.189Z - Shell: 1.3.7 - Renderer: 52.0.2743.82 - Node: 6.5.0 ## OS Version - OS Name: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro - Version: 10.0.14393 Build 14393 ## Example code File: https://gist.github.com/marcomorain/9b84f35ada35e0eceb030ff27fba2e1f ``` tsx import * as React from 'react' var restaurantName = 'My Restaurant' var closedAlert: JSX.Element = (

{restaurantName} is Closed

) ``` ## Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a `.tsx` file in vscode with some significant whitespace in a JSX element. 2. Format the document (via command palette or format on save). ## Expected: The space between `}` and `is Closed` is preserved, ultimately producing the string `My Restaurant is Closed` ## Actual The space between `}` and `is Closed` is removed, ultimately producing the string `My Restaurantis Closed`

data.title: Incorrect Java syntax highlighting for parentheses inside strings inside parentheses beginning a new line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 7 (64-bit)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new file a select the Java language mode
2. Paste the following code into the editor:

``` java
new String 
    ("(A)" + "B");
new String("Following line");
```

"String", the quoted string literal, and all syntax following this line will be miscoloured. Compare:

``` java
new String("(A)" + "B");
new String("Following line");
```

![java-syntax-highlighting-problem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/757021/19267853/f303aebc-8fa8-11e6-8e64-57dbce4b9b97.png)

Interestingly, GitHub's colourizer also seems to suffer from the same issue.

data.title: How to set default selected suggestion?
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.6.0 - OS Version: OS X 10.11.5 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install Reactjs snippets extension. 2. Change the user config `"editor.snippetSuggestions": "top"`. 3. Type rcc in a new jsx file The snippet suggestion for the react is on the TOP, but default selected suggestion is `RTCDtlsTransportStateChangedEvent`. How to make the default selected suggestion is the snippet suggestion. How to disable the suggestions such like `RTCIceCandidate` and `WebGLBuffer`? I don't use Web API too much.

data.title: Can anyone bundle marketplace plugins with the install?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: windows 7 x64

On the release notes [you can bundle extensions](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_6#_builtin-extensions) and I wondered if that's exposed in the installer in some way? Having trouble finding any docs.

I want to put the python extensions onto all the computers here as our mandatory profiles wipe their installed locations for users.

data.title: [coffeescript] Weird syntax highlighting
data.body:
When color theme that highlights property name definition is selected and property name starts with it and is indented, color highlighting is broken, see printscreen.

http://prntscr.com/csf61j
- VSCode Version: Version 1.6.0 (1.6.0)
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan Version 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create coffee file
2. Write following code

```
item = yes
if item
  itemText = 'Yeah'
```

data.title: Control font size in suggest, hover, parameter hints widgets

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 14393.222

I appreciate that 1.6 improves Hover & IntelliSense UI which makes hints become more readable. However the IntelliSense & Snippets dropdowns seem not as good as before, since the font-size grows quite large:

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6079112/19264037/bca424e0-8fd1-11e6-865e-d0cd3bfe3779.png)

I have no idea whether the change was on purpose or not, shall we move this weird appearance back to normal ? Or maybe there could be a config option to adjust font-size in dropdowns.

data.title: Color theme breaks in .TS files if HTML contains tags that do not require closing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: 10.12

data.body:

My main project  was with grunt & angular, I have fully configured the vscode with jshint and other features for the grunt & angular, but when I change to other ones, VSCode launch me an error, because it doesn't found the jshint configuration, etc.

Thanks.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 x64

The code that handles the setting is in:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/themes/electron-browser/stylesContributions.ts#L129

I tried underline and italic ... worked fine.  So it seems to be specific to the bold property and maybe the version of chromium shipped with vscode and my OS?

This works totally fine when using vscode 1.5.
